CaseType.Description: This object represents a customer of your business. Use it to create recurring charges, save payment and contact information, and track payments that belong to the same customer.
CaseType.Name: Customer

Field.Description: Unique identifier for the object.
Field.Name: id

Field.Description: Default options for invoice PDF rendering for this customer.
Field.Name: rendering_options

Field.Description: The date that the transaction’s net funds become available in the Stripe balance.
Field.Name: available_on

Field.Description: ID of the invoice rendering template to be used for this customer’s invoices. If set, the template will be used on all invoices for this customer unless a template is set directly on the invoice.
Field.Name: template

Field.Description: ransaction type: adjustment, advance, advance_funding, anticipation_repayment, application_fee, application_fee_refund, charge, climate_order_purchase, climate_order_refund, connect_collection_transfer, contribution, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, issuing_dispute, issuing_transaction, obligation_outbound, obligation_reversal_inbound, payment, payment_failure_refund, payment_network_reserve_hold, payment_network_reserve_release, payment_refund, payment_reversal, payment_unreconciled, payout, payout_cancel, payout_failure, payout_minimum_balance_hold, payout_minimum_balance_release, refund, refund_failure, reserve_transaction, reserved_funds, stripe_fee, stripe_fx_fee, stripe_balance_payment_debit, stripe_balance_payment_debit_reversal, tax_fee, topup, topup_reversal, transfer, transfer_cancel, transfer_failure, or transfer_refund. Learn more about balance transaction types and what they represent. To classify transactions for accounting purposes, consider reporting_category instead.
Field.Name: type

Field.Description: Default footer to be displayed on invoices for this customer.
Field.Name: footer

Field.Description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.
Field.Name: created

Field.Description: Default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer.
Field.Name: custom_fields

Field.Description: Customer name
Field.Name: name

Field.Description: Customer phone (including extension)
Field.Name: phone

Field.Description: The transaction’s net funds status in the Stripe balance, which are either available or pending.
Field.Name: status

Field.Description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.
Field.Name: description

Field.Description: Gross amount of this transaction (in cents). A positive value represents funds charged to another party, and a negative value represents funds sent to another party.
Field.Name: amount

Field.Description: The name of the custom field.
Field.Name: name

Field.Description: Customer shipping address.
Field.Name: address

Field.Description: The customer’s address.
Field.Name: address

Field.Description: The customer’s phone number.
Field.Name: phone

Field.Description: balance transaction type for example, "payments"
Field.Name: balance_type

Field.Description: Mailing and shipping address for the customer. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.
Field.Name: shipping

Field.Description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).
Field.Name: line2

Field.Description: transaction id
Field.Name: id

Field.Description: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.
Field.Name: object

Field.Description: ID of the Connect application that earned the fee.
Field.Name: application

Field.Description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
Field.Name: currency

Field.Description: This field holds the reference to a Customer instance.
Field.Name: Customer Reference

Field.Description: If applicable, this transaction uses an exchange rate. If money converts from currency A to currency B, then the amount in currency A, multipled by the exchange_rate, equals the amount in currency B. For example, if you charge a customer 10.00 EUR, the PaymentIntent’s amount is 1000 and currency is eur. If this converts to 12.34 USD in your Stripe account, the BalanceTransaction’s amount is 1234, its currency is usd, and the exchange_rate is 1.234.
Field.Name: exchange_rate

Field.Description: State, county, province, or region.
Field.Name: state

Field.Description: Three-letter ISO code for the currency the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.
Field.Name: currency

Field.Description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.
Field.Name: key

Field.Description: How line-item prices and amounts will be displayed with respect to tax on invoice PDFs.
Field.Name: amount_tax_display

Field.Description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.
Field.Name: created

Field.Description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.
Field.Name: value

Field.Description: Amount of the fee, in cents.
Field.Name: amount

Field.Description: The customer’s email address.
Field.Name: email

Field.Description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
Field.Name: currency

Field.Description: This transaction relates to the Stripe object.
Field.Name: source

Field.Description: Net impact to a Stripe balance (in cents). A positive value represents incrementing a Stripe balance, and a negative value decrementing a Stripe balance. You can calculate the net impact of a transaction on a balance by amount - fee
Field.Name: net

Field.Description: ZIP or postal code.
Field.Name: postal_code

Field.Description: The BalanceTransaction object’s reporting_category field improves on the type field by providing a more-useful grouping for most finance and reporting purposes. The following sections highlight the new field’s advantages.
Field.Name: reporting_category

Field.Description: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.
Field.Name: object

Field.Description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).
Field.Name: line1

Field.Description:
Tracks the most recent state change on any invoice belonging to the customer. Paying an invoice or marking it uncollectible via the API will set this field to false. An automatic payment failure or passing the invoice.due_date will set this field to true.

If an invoice becomes uncollectible by dunning, delinquent doesn’t reset to false.

If you care whether the customer has paid their most recent subscription invoice, use subscription.status instead. Paying or marking uncollectible any customer invoice regardless of whether it is the latest invoice for a subscription will always set this field to false.
Field.Name: delinquent

Field.Description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).
Field.Name: country

Field.Description: Type of the fee, one of: application_fee, payment_method_passthrough_fee, stripe_fee or tax.
Field.Name: type

Field.Description: This field holds the reference to a Customer Address instance.
Field.Name: Customer Address Reference

Field.Description: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.
Field.Name: livemode

Field.Description: Describes the customer’s tax exemption status, which is none, exempt, or reverse. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: “Reverse charge”.
Field.Name: tax_exempt

Field.Description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers.
Field.Name: invoice_prefix

Field.Description: The suffix of the customer’s next invoice number (for example, 0001). When the account uses account level sequencing, this parameter is ignored in API requests and the field omitted in API responses.
Field.Name: next_invoice_sequence

Field.Description: The value of the custom field.
Field.Name: value

Field.Description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.
Field.Name: metadata

Field.Description: ID of the test clock that this customer belongs to.
Field.Name: test_clock

Field.Description: Detailed breakdown of fees (in cents) paid for this transaction.
Field.Name: fee_details

Field.Description: Fees (in cents) paid for this transaction. Represented as a positive integer when assessed.
Field.Name: fee

Field.Description: The current balance, if any, that’s stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that’s added to their next invoice. The balance only considers amounts that Stripe hasn’t successfully applied to any invoice. It doesn’t reflect unpaid invoices. This balance is only taken into account after invoices finalize.
Field.Name: balance

Field.Description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.
Field.Name: description

Field.Description: ID of the default payment source for the customer.
Field.Name: default_source

Field.Description: ID of a payment method that’s attached to the customer, to be used as the customer’s default payment method for subscriptions and invoices.
Field.Name: default_payment_method

Field.Description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.
Field.Name: created

Field.Description: address.city
Field.Name: city
